CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 1, 1955, page 21 reads: "Miles of Dimes' Gift - Members of the Young Adult Missionary Group at St. James AME Church were the first to answer the Courier's plea to help a Clairton widow and her children who were about to be evicted from their home on Christmas Day. They are pictured presenting a check of $10 to Lorenzo A. Hill, auditor of the Courier. From left to right, they are Mr. Hill, Mrs. Dorcas Amaker, Mrs. Susie Neal, Mrs. Alice Poindexter, supervisor, and Mrs. Olive Mae Miles. - Harris Photo"
TitMainTitle: Lorenzo A. Hill, accepting check from members of the Young Adult Missionary Group at St. James AME Church, including from left: Dorcas Amaker, Susie Neil, Alice Poindexter, and Olive Mae Miles, standing in interior with calendar and window with square panes
